fr_ours: Improves energy production efficiency in molten carbonate fuel cells by recycling hydrogen-rich exhaust back to the anode.
fr_competitor: Addresses excessive carbon dioxide emissions in hydrocarbon cracking systems during olefin production by converting methane into electricity, reducing overall carbon footprint
tu_ours: Enhances hydrogen utilization beyond traditional 70% to 75% by recycling excess hydrogen from the anode exit to the anode inlet.
tu_competitor: The system separates the first cracking product stream into hydrogen-rich methane and secondary streams, then utilizes a fuel cell to convert the methane into electricity
sv_ours: Potentially reduces operational costs by improving fuel efficiency and increasing energy production.
sv_competitor: The invention contributes to business success by providing regulatory compliance with emission standards, reducing carbon footprint for hydrocarbon cracking systems, and enabling market applicability in various power generation applications
overall_reason: The competitor patent offers a broader strategic value by addressing regulatory compliance, reducing carbon footprint, and enabling market applicability in various power generation applications. The technical uniqueness of our patent, although valuable, does not outweigh these benefits.
